title: nf-core/viralmetagenome pipeline parameters
description: A bioinformatics best-practice analysis pipeline for untargeted viral genome reconstruction and to identify intra-host variants from metagenomic sequencing data.

input_output_options.title: Input/output options
input_output_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

input.description: Path to comma-separated file containing information about the samples in the experiment.
input.help_text: You will need to create a design file with information about the samples in your experiment before running the pipeline. Use this parameter to specify its location. It has to be a comma-separated file with 3 columns, and a header row. See [usage docs](https://nf-co.re/viralmetagenome/usage#samplesheet-input).

outdir.description: The output directory where the results will be saved. You have to use absolute paths to storage on Cloud infrastructure.
outdir.help_text: Folder created (if missing) to collect all final pipeline results.

metadata.description: Sample metadata that is included in the multiqc report
metadata.help_text: Optional tab/semicolon/comma separated file with extra per-sample annotations (e.g. collection_date, host, location). Columns are merged into MultiQC. Filename must end with .csv or .tsv.

email.help_text: Set this parameter to your e-mail address to get a summary e-mail with details of the run sent to you when the workflow exits. If set in your user config file (`~/.nextflow/config`) then you don't need to specify this on the command line for every run.

preprocessing_options.title: Preprocessing options
preprocessing_options.description: Options related to the trimming, low complexity and host removal steps of the reads

skip_preprocessing.description: Skip read preprocessing and use input reads for downstream analysis
skip_preprocessing.help_text: Disables trimming, UMI handling, low-complexity and host / contaminant filtering. Only use if reads are already cleaned.

skip_fastqc.description: Skip read quality statistics summary tool 'fastqc'
skip_fastqc.help_text: Skips FastQC, a tool that reports on a lot of unmapped read statistics. Not recommended for novel datasets.

save_final_reads.description: Save reads after the final preprocessing step
save_final_reads.help_text: Publishes the cleaned, decontaminated, decomplexified FASTQs for reuse / archival. Disable to save space.

save_intermediate_reads.description: Save reads after every preprocessing step
save_intermediate_reads.help_text: Stores FASTQs after each sub-step (trimming, host removal, etc.). Useful for troubleshooting; large storage overhead.

with_umi.help_text: Set true if reads include UMIs so they can be extracted and used for sequencing error suppression.

skip_umi_extract.help_text: Skip extraction if UMIs already embedded in read header. Ignored unless with_umi is true.

umi_deduplicate.description: Specify at what level UMI deduplication should occur.
umi_deduplicate.help_text: read: collapse identical UMI-tagged pairs based only on UMI similarity and read similarity; mapping: collapse after alignment, takes also mapping position into account; both: perform both deduplication levels.

umi_discard_read.description: Discard R1 / R2 if required 0, meaning not to discard
umi_discard_read.help_text: Set to 1 or 2 to drop a mate lacking valid UMI. 0 keeps both reads.

skip_trimming.help_text: Disables adapter / quality trimming. Only safe if reads already trimmed.

adapter_fasta.help_text: Custom adapter FASTA. Leave unset to rely on auto-detection / defaults.

save_trimmed_fail.description: Specify true to save files that failed to pass trimming thresholds ending in `*.fail.fastq.gz`

save_merged.description: Specify true to save all merged reads to a file ending in `*.merged.fastq.gz`
save_merged.help_text: Publishes merged overlapping pairs (if merging performed).

min_trimmed_reads.description: Input files with fewer than these reads will be filtered out of the "reads" output channel

merge_reads.description: Specify if reads coming from the same group or original sample should be merged for the downstream analyses
merge_reads.help_text: Concatenate technical replicates per sample after QC.

skip_complexity_filtering.description: Skip filtering of low complexity regions in reads
skip_complexity_filtering.help_text: Low-complexity sequences are defined as having commonly found stretches of nucleotides with limited information content (e.g. the dinucleotide repeat CACACACACA). Such sequences can produce a large number of high-scoring but biologically insignificant results in database searches

decomplexifier.description: Specify the decomplexifier to use, bbduk or prinseq
decomplexifier.help_text: prinseq: entropy/DUST filtering; bbduk: k-mer / entropy based with more tuning options.

contaminants.description: Reference files containing adapter and/or contaminant sequences for sequence kmer matching (used by bbduk)

skip_hostremoval.description: Skip the removal of host read sequences
skip_hostremoval.help_text: Disable host subtraction. Only if reads already host-filtered or no host expected.

host_k2_db.description: Kraken2 database used to remove host and contamination
host_k2_db.help_text: Point to a custom Kraken2 DB with host + common lab contaminants for faster classification.

skip_host_fastqc.description: Skip the fastqc step after host & contaminants were removed

arguments_prinseq_reads.description: Arguments for Prinseq tool for reads

arguments_kraken2_host.description: Arguments for Kraken2 tool for host removal

metagenomic_diversity.title: Metagenomic diversity
metagenomic_diversity.description: Parameters used to determine the metagenomic diversity of the sample

skip_read_classification.description: Skip determining the metagenomic diversity of the sample
skip_read_classification.help_text: Disables all read-level taxonomic classification (kraken2 / kaiju / bracken).

read_classifiers.description: Specify the taxonomic read classifiers, choices are 'kaiju,kraken2'
read_classifiers.help_text: Comma-separated (max 3) from: kaiju, kraken2, bracken. More tools increase runtime.

save_databases.help_text: Publish downloaded classifier DBs for reuse / provenance (large) to the output dir.

kraken2_db.help_text: Path or URL to Kraken2 DB tarball/folder.

kraken2_save_reads.description: Save classified and unclassified reads as fastq files
kraken2_save_reads.help_text: Exports two FASTQs (classified & unclassified) for downstream reuse.

kraken2_save_readclassification.description: Save summary overview of read classifications in a txt file
kraken2_save_readclassification.help_text: Stores detailed per-read classification summary (kreport format).

kraken2_save_minimizers.help_text: Advanced debugging: writes minimizer usage tables.

kaiju_db.help_text: Kaiju DB (e.g. RVDB). Larger DBs increase sensitivity but need more RAM.

kaiju_taxon_rank.description: Level of taxa rank that needs to be determined

assembly.title: Assembly
assembly.description: Parameters relating to the used assembly methods

skip_assembly.description: Skip de novo assembly of reads
skip_assembly.help_text: Disables the complete denovo route of the pipeline (assembly, contig classification, etc.).

assemblers.description: The specified tools for de novo assembly, multiple options are possible

spades_mode.help_text: Use rnaviral/corona/metaviral for viral datasets; meta for complex metagenomes; isolate for high-depth single (unsegmented) genomes.

spades_hmm.description: File or directory with amino acid HMMs for Spades HMM-guided mode.
spades_hmm.help_text: Optional custom HMMs guiding SPAdes extension around conserved protein domains.

spades_yml.description: Path to yml file containing read information.
spades_yml.help_text: The raw FASTQ files listed in this YAML file MUST be supplied to the respective illumina/pacbio/nanopore input channel(s) _in addition_ to this YML. File entries in this yml must contain only the file name and no paths.

skip_contig_prinseq.description: Skip the filtering of low complexity contigs with prinseq
skip_contig_prinseq.help_text: Retains low-complexity contigs which can be assembly artefacts.

skip_sspace_basic.description: Skip the contig extension with sspace_basic

read_distance.description: Specify the mean distance between the paired reads
read_distance.help_text: Approximate library insert size (not read length). Influences sspace_basic extension heuristics.

read_distance_sd.description: Specify the deviation of the mean distance that is allowed.

arguments_prinseq_contig.description: Arguments for Prinseq tool for contigs

polishing.title: Polishing
polishing.description: Parameters relating to the refinement of de novo contigs

skip_polishing.description: Skip the refinement/polishing of contigs through reference based scaffolding and read mapping

save_intermediate_polishing.help_text: There are multiple processes within the polishing subworkflow that might not contain relevant information

reference_pool.description: Set of fasta sequences used as potential references for the contigs

skip_precluster.description: Skip the preclustering of assemblies to facilitate downstream processing of assemblies

keep_unclassified.description: Keep the contigs that could not be classified with the taxonomic databases (`kaiju_db` & `kraken2_db`)
keep_unclassified.help_text: Within the preclustering step, all contigs will get a taxonomic classification using the provided databases for the metagenomic tools. In some cases, the number of unclassified contigs can be very large if the database is restrictive. This will result in large clusters in downstream processing that can take up a lot of resources despite not being a priority in some analyses. So set it to `True` if you want to keep unclassified contigs and set it to `False` if you don't want to keep them.

precluster_classifiers.description: Specify the metagenomic classifiers to use for contig taxonomy classification: 'kraken2,kaiju'

network_clustering.description: (only with mash) Algorithm to partition the network.
network_clustering.help_text:
Mash creates a distance matrix that gets translated into a network of connectected nodes where the edges represent the similarity. This network is then split up using the specified method.

 - [leiden](https://leidenalg.readthedocs.io/en/stable/intro.html) algorithm: a hierarchical clustering algorithm, that recursively merges communities into single nodes by greedily optimizing the modularity
 - [connected_components] algorithm: a clustering algorithm that defines the largest possible communities where each node within a subset is reachable from every other node in the same subset via any edge .

identity_threshold.description: Identity threshold value used in clustering algorithms

perc_reads_contig.description: Minimum cumulated sum of mapped read percentages of each member from a cluster group, set to 0 to disable
perc_reads_contig.help_text: Setting this variable will remove clusters that have a low cumulated sum of mapped read percentages. This can be used to remove clusters that have a low coverage and are likely to be false positives.

min_contig_size.help_text: Setting this to a low value will result in a large number of questionable contigs and an increase in computation time

max_n_perc.description: Define the maximum percentage of ambiguous bases in a contig

skip_singleton_filtering.description: Skip the filtering of contigs that did not cluster together with other contigs
skip_singleton_filtering.help_text: Setting this to true will cause the pipeline not to remove contigs that don't have similar contigs. Filtering settings can be further specified with `min_contig_size` and `max_n_100kbp`.

arguments_kraken2_contig.description: Arguments for Kraken2 tool for contigs

arguments_kaiju_contig.description: Arguments for Kaiju tool for contigs

iterative_consensus_refinement.title: Iterative consensus refinement
iterative_consensus_refinement.description: Define parameters for iterations to update de novo consensus using reference based improvements

skip_iterative_refinement.description: Don't realign reads to consensus sequences and redefine the consensus through (multiple) iterations
skip_iterative_refinement.help_text: Disable iterative polishing cycles. Final consensus will be the scaffolded contigs.

iterative_refinement_cycles.help_text: Each cycle remaps reads to the current consensus.

intermediate_variant_caller.help_text: Specify variant caller used in iterative refinement.

call_intermediate_variants.help_text: Always true if intermediate consensus caller is bcftools; when false, skips per-cycle variant output generation.

intermediate_consensus_caller.description: Consensus tool used for calling new consensus during iterations
intermediate_consensus_caller.help_text: Determines how per-cycle variants are applied to produce updated consensus sequences.

intermediate_mapping_stats.help_text: Collect coverage/alignment metrics per cycle to monitor convergence (adds minor overhead).

variant_analysis.title: Variant analysis
variant_analysis.description: Parameters relating to the analysis of variants associated to contigs and scaffolds

skip_variant_calling.description: Skip the analysis of variants for the external reference or contigs
skip_variant_calling.help_text: Turns off SNP/indel calling and consensus sequence generation, for denovo assembly route these will be true minor variants, for the refernece mapping routes these will be not be true minor variant.

skip_vcf_annotation.description: Skip the annotation of the VCF file
skip_vcf_annotation.help_text: Skips functional effect annotation (e.g. SnpEff). VCF still produced with raw variant data.

mapper.description: Define which mapping tool needs to be used when mapping reads to reference
mapper.help_text: bwamem2: fast, memory-efficient. bowtie2: flexible, alternative scoring.

mapping_constraints.description: Sequence(s) to use as a reference for mapping instead of the de novo contigs or scaffolds
mapping_constraints.help_text: Perform a separate standard read mapping + consensus calling analysis to create a reference-based consensus from the provided reference sequence(s). Optionally the best reference is selected using Mash.

deduplicate.help_text: UMI mode: UMI-tools consensus/dedup. Non-UMI: Picard MarkDuplicates. Reduces PCR duplicates for accurate allele frequencies.

variant_caller.description: Define the variant caller to use: 'ivar' or 'bcftools'

consensus_caller.description: Consensus tool used for calling new consensus in final iteration

min_mapped_reads.description: Define the minimum number of mapped reads in order to continue the variant and consensus calling
min_mapped_reads.help_text: Samples, reference combinations below this total mapped read threshold are skipped for variant/consensus calling to avoid unreliable results.

min_consensus_depth.help_text: Positions with depth < threshold are masked (e.g. N) in the consensus for low confidence handling.

allele_frequency.description: Minimum allele frequency threshold for calling consensus
allele_frequency.help_text: Major allele frequency required to set a base in consensus. Lower values retain minor variants but risk noise.

mapping_stats.description: Calculate summary statistics in final iteration
mapping_stats.help_text: Generates alignment QC metrics (coverage, flagstat, duplication) to assess variant calling reliability.

arguments_snpeff.description: Arguments for SnpEff tool for variant annotation

genome_qc.title: Consensus QC
genome_qc.description: Apply different quality control techniques on the generated consensus genomes

skip_consensus_qc.description: Skip the quality measurements on consensus genomes

skip_checkv.description: Skip the use of checkv for quality check

checkv_db.description: Reference database used by checkv for consensus quality control
checkv_db.help_text: If not given, the most recent one is downloaded.

skip_consensus_annotation.description: Skip the annotation of the consensus constructs

annotation_db.description: Database used for annotation of the consensus constructs
annotation_db.help_text: The metadata fields are stored in the fasta comment as `key1:"value1"|key2:"value2"|...` see docs/databases.md for more information.

skip_prokka.description: Skip gene estimation & annotation with prokka

prokka_db.description: Define a prokka `--protein` database for protein annotation
prokka_db.help_text: Specify a custom protein database for Prokka annotation

skip_quast.description: Skip the use of QUAST for quality check

skip_blast_qc.description: Skip the blast search of contigs to the provided reference DB

skip_alignment_qc.description: Skip creating an alignment of each the collapsed clusters and each iterative step

mmseqs_searchtype.description: Specify the search algorithm to use for mmseqs. 0: auto 1: amino acid, 2: translated, 3: nucleotide, 4: translated nucleotide alignment

institutional_config_options.title: Institutional config options
institutional_config_options.description: Parameters used to describe centralised config profiles. These should not be edited.
institutional_config_options.help_text: The centralised nf-core configuration profiles use a handful of pipeline parameters to describe themselves. This information is then printed to the Nextflow log when you run a pipeline. You should not need to change these values when you run a pipeline.

custom_config_version.description: Git commit id for Institutional configs.

custom_config_base.help_text: If you're running offline, Nextflow will not be able to fetch the institutional config files from the internet. If you don't need them, then this is not a problem. If you do need them, you should download the files from the repo and tell Nextflow where to find them with this parameter.

generic_options.title: Generic options
generic_options.description: Less common options for the pipeline, typically set in a config file.
generic_options.help_text:
These options are common to all nf-core pipelines and allow you to customise some of the core preferences for how the pipeline runs.

Typically these options would be set in a Nextflow config file loaded for all pipeline runs, such as `~/.nextflow/config`.

publish_dir_mode.description: Method used to save pipeline results to output directory.
publish_dir_mode.help_text: The Nextflow `publishDir` option specifies which intermediate files should be saved to the output directory. This option tells the pipeline what method should be used to move these files. See [Nextflow docs](https://www.nextflow.io/docs/latest/process.html#publishdir) for details.

email_on_fail.description: Email address for completion summary, only when pipeline fails.
email_on_fail.help_text: An email address to send a summary email to when the pipeline is completed - ONLY sent if the pipeline does not exit successfully.

plaintext_email.description: Send plain-text email instead of HTML.

max_multiqc_email_size.description: File size limit when attaching MultiQC reports to summary emails.

monochrome_logs.description: Do not use coloured log outputs.

hook_url.description: Incoming hook URL for messaging service
hook_url.help_text: Incoming hook URL for messaging service. Currently, MS Teams and Slack are supported.

multiqc_title.description: MultiQC report title. Printed as page header, used for filename if not otherwise specified.

multiqc_config.description: Custom config file to supply to MultiQC.

multiqc_logo.description: Custom logo file to supply to MultiQC. File name must also be set in the MultiQC config file

multiqc_methods_description.description: Custom MultiQC yaml file containing HTML including a methods description.

custom_table_headers.description: Custom yaml file containing the table column names selection and new names.

validate_params.description: Boolean whether to validate parameters against the schema at runtime

pipelines_testdata_base_path.description: Base URL or local path to location of pipeline test dataset files

trace_report_suffix.description: Suffix to add to the trace report filename. Default is the date and time in the format yyyy-MM-dd_HH-mm-ss.

prefix.description: Prefix of all output files followed by [date]_[pipelineversion]_[runName]
prefix.help_text: In order to track your files better, you can add a custom prefix to all output files. The prefix will be followed by the date, pipeline version and run name.

global_prefix.description: Global prefix set if you don't want metadata embedded in the output filenames
